definition: to cost one dearly/to end disastrously/to pay bitterly
variant of 吃[chi1]
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
deficiency/deficit/luckily/it's lucky that.../(often ironically) fancy that...

sentences.english: I must point out that further delay would be unwise.
sentences.chinese: 我必须指明再延误就要吃大亏了。

sentences.english: Passwords are an essential part of life online and if we are not careful about keeping them secret, they can cause big problems.
sentences.chinese: 网络离不开密码，密码保存不注意，很可能吃大亏。

sentences.english: He thought we would be taken in, but on the contrary, it was he who got shorn.
sentences.chinese: 他本以为我们会上当，可是吃大亏的反而是他。

sentences.english: And if we're not careful about keeping them secret, they can cause big problems.
sentences.chinese: 密码保存不注意，很可能吃大亏。

sentences.english: They are now bitterly paying for their lack of vision.
sentences.chinese: 由于缺乏远见，他们正在吃大亏。

sentences.english: Don't act up or you will be spoiled some day.
sentences.chinese: 不要卖弄，否则有一天你会吃大亏。

sentences.english: I must point out that further delay will be unwise.
sentences.chinese: 我必须指明再延误就要吃大亏了。

sentences.english: Mechanical copying of anything foreign would be disastrous.
sentences.chinese: 机械地照搬外国的东西要吃大亏的。

definition: to suffer losses/to come to grief/to lose out/to get the worst of it/to be at a disadvantage/unfortunately
to suffer/to suffer for one's actions/to pay dearly/to burn one's fingers
to meet with unexpected failure (idiom)/to fail miserably (where failure was not expected)
to fall head over heels/(fig.) to come a cropper
to be taken advantage of
it will cause no end of trouble (idiom)
taken in (by sb's deceit)/to be fooled/to be duped
advantageous/favorable/to benefit at others' expense/to take unfair advantage
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
to save a little only to lose a lot (idiom)
lit. if you can't eat it all, you'll have to take it home (idiom)/fig. you'll have to take the consequences
pinyin: chi1 bu5 liao3 dou1 zhe5 zou3

definition: failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
having given away a bride, to lose one's army on top of it (idiom)/to suffer a double loss after trying to trick the enemy
pinyin: pei2 le5 fu1 ren2 you4 zhe2 bing1

definition: lit. to try to steal a chicken only to end up losing the rice used to lure it (idiom)/fig. to try to gain an advantage only to end up worse off/to go for wool and come back shorn
pinyin: tou1 ji1 bu4 cheng2 shi2 ba3 mi3

definition: think three times then go (idiom); don't act before you've thought it through carefully
to underestimate the enemy
